content.description: The first 25' of the climb are sustained and strenuous. A hollow flake inside the crack near the bottom can be used as a hand hold. After the crux, the crack widens to 5+" but the difficulty tapers to 10- because features on the faces appear. The rock quality varies from fair to very good (2 out of 5 stars).
content.protection: Cams from 3" to 5+" or equivalent Big Bros are needed for this strenuous offwidth. Medium cams can be used for an anchor.

climbs.name: One Size Does Not Fit All

content.description: This fun chimney is easier to climb than it looks from the bottom because of the numerous hidden hand holds and features adjacent to the chimney. We dislodged one large block but the majority of the route is on solid rock. This is a 3 out of 5 star climb.
content.protection: Large Big Bros for a 1' - 2' wide chimney are necessary to lead this climb. You can also set up a TR with medium cams at the top.

climbs.name: My Helmet is Bigger Than Your Helmet

content.description: Ascend the offwidth crack in the obvious dihedral that begins on a large platform. At the top of the triangular block, continue left to the top of the rectangular rock where a small juniper tree is located. A sustained climb with engaging moves on good rock (3 out of 5 stars).
content.protection: Mostly 2" - 5" cams for pro. A few small TCU's and stoppers are useful near the top in discontinuous seams. A small juniper tree can be slung for an anchor.
